sentence: We expect the world's largest home improvement retailer Home Depot Inc.HD to beat expectations when it reports first-quarter fiscal 2015 results on May 19, before the market opens.
Our proven model shows that Home Depot may beat earnings because it has the right combination of two key components.
Positive Zacks ESP: Home Depot currently has an Earnings ESP of +0.87%.
This is because the Most Accurate estimate stands at $1.16 per share, while the Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at $1.15.
Zacks Rank #3 (Hold): Note that stocks with a Zacks Rank #1, 2 and 3 have a higher chance of beating earnings.
The Sell-rated stocks (#4 and 5) should never be considered going into an earnings announcement.
The combination of Home Depot's Zacks Rank #3 and Earnings ESP of +0.87% makes us confident of an earnings beat.

Being the world's largest home improvement retailer, we believe that Home Depot is well positioned to benefit from the gradually recovering housing market and expect the company to continue with its upbeat performance going forward.
Following a spectacular year, Home Depot hiked its quarterly dividend and announced its capital allocation plans.
Moreover, Home Depot has topped the Zacks Consensus Estimate in the trailing four quarters with an average positive surprise of 5.4%.
In the last concluded quarter, the company beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 12.4%.

Other Stocks to Consider

Home Depot is not the only firm looking up this earnings season.

The following companies are also likely to beat earnings in the to-be-reported quarter:

American Eagle Outfitters Inc. AEO has an Earnings ESP of +18.18% and a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
Campbell Soup Company CPB has an Earnings ESP of +1.96% and a Zacks Rank #3.
DICK's Sporting Goods Inc. DKS has an Earnings ESP of +3.77% and a Zacks Rank #3.
